ai-iti104:0.3_0: The Chapter on the Holy Offering of the Teaching
ai-iti104:1.1_0: For this was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti104:2.1_0: “Mendicants, take a mendicant who is accomplished in ethics, immersion, wisdom, freedom, and the knowledge and vision of freedom. They advise and instruct. They educate, encourage, fire up, and inspire, and can rightly explain the true teaching. Even the sight of those mendicants is very helpful, I say.
ai-iti104:2.6_0: or go forth after them is very helpful, I say.
ai-iti104:2.8_0: For one who frequents and associates with such mendicants, their incomplete spectrum of ethics is completed. Their incomplete spectrum of immersion ... wisdom ... freedom ... knowledge and vision of freedom is completed.
ai-iti104:2.9_0: those mendicants who are teachers said to live with their eyes; they’re said to act with terrifying eyes; the wrists, keys, crooked, rounded, fancy them, and also called ‘high horsedranced’.”
ai-iti104:3.3_0: that is, those who have developed themselves,
ai-iti104:5.2_0: the astute do regard them well,
ai-iti104:5.3_0: by understanding the end of rebirth,
ai-iti104:5.4_0: they don’t come back to future lives.”
ai-iti104:6.1_0: That is what the Buddha has heard.
